title: Coffey pleased to revisit Dayton
subtitle: Coffey pleased to revisit Dayton with Caravan
body: DAYTON, Ohio -- As he worked his way up the organization, Reds reliever Todd Coffey spent the 2002 and 2003 seasons playing for the low Class A Dayton affiliate.  How much did Coffey enjoy the experience?  "I had great times. I love the people here," Coffey said. "My wife and I named our second daughter after the city -- Haley Elizabeth Dayton Coffey. It's a great city." Mark Sheldon is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Mark Sheldon
